details.content: Russian President Vladimir Putin's spokesman has earlier said that he hopes the summit with US President Donald Trump is a "baby step" toward fixing exceptionally bad US-Russian relations.

details.title: Trump attacks prior  US administrations 'foolishness' heading into Putin showdown
details.content: Trump determined to forge a personal bond with the Kremlin chief, saying only 'stupidity' by prior administrations had brought US-Russian ties to their present low.

Hours before the Helsinki summit, Trump was asked if he would press Putin over Russia's alleged manipulation of the 2016 election that brought the mercurial property tycoon to power. He said only: "We'll do just fine."

details.title: EU official urges Trump, Putin not to destroy global order
details.content: Speaking before the summit, European Council President Donald Tusk appealed for leaders to avoid wrecking a political and economic order that nurtured a peaceful Europe and developing China.

Russia’s foreign ministry also agreed with Trump’s assessment that US-Russia relations have never been worse.

We agree https://t.co/7l087Qwmj3

— MFA Russia 🇷🇺 (@mfa_russia) 16 July 2018

details.title: Trump arrives at Finnish palace
details.content:
Trump has arrived at Finland's Presidential Palace for the summit .Putin arrived minutes earlier at the palace in Helsinki for the summit, which consists of a one-on-one meeting and a larger working lunch, and will conclude with a joint news conference.

President Trump has arrived at the Presidential Palace in Helsinki, Finland for his meeting with President Putin.

— The White House (@WhiteHouse) 16 July 2018

details.title: Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin meet in Helsinki
details.content:
WATCH: US President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin meet in Helsinki (Finland) https://t.co/eVO8xrtLKp

— ANI (@ANI) July 16, 2018
President Donald Trump says at the start of his summit with Russia's President Vladimir Putin in Helsinki that he thinks "the world wants to see us get along."

I think we have great opportunities together. Frankly, we have not been getting along very well for the last number of years. I think we will end up having an extraordinary relationship: US President Donald Trump on meeting Russia President Vladimir Putin pic.twitter.com/fmsCRhYQeJ

— ANI (@ANI) July 16, 2018

details.title: Radio journalist Jamie Dupree provides more updates
details.content:
Notes from President Trump's remarks in photo op with Putin:

+ Trump flatters Putin over World Cup
+ "I think we have great opportunities together"
+ "I think we will end up having an extraordinary relationship"
+ "Getting along with Russia is a good thing, not a bad thing" pic.twitter.com/PqjIogrKvK

— Jamie Dupree (@jamiedupree) July 16, 2018
At the start of the summit, Trump says that the two countries  have "great opportunities" and can have an "extraordinary relationship"
Trump and Putin are currently in a one-on-one meeting, with only translators in the room.

This is how Helsinki, Finland is welcoming President Trump as he is set to meet with Russian President Putin.

"Mr. President, welcome to the land of free press"#TreasonSummit #HelsinkiSummit pic.twitter.com/o89mD1qJSD

— Ed Krassenstein (@EdKrassen) July 16, 2018

details.title: Demonstrations against the leaders
details.content: While the summit goes on, abortion-rights activists and anti-fascist protesters take to the streets to demonstrate against the two leaders in various landmarks of Helsinki and outside the presidential palace.

Gotta just love this anti-Trump, pro reproductive rights protest in Helsinki! Brilliant! @resistgag #womensrights #resistgag #TrumPutinHelsinki #HelsinkiSummit pic.twitter.com/6sSCR3dB41

— Marja Peltola (@marja_peltola) July 16, 2018

details.title: Putin, Trump to hold another bilateral meeting with more aides
details.content:
Happening Now: President Trump has a 1:1 bilateral meeting with President Putin. Later they will hold an expanded bilateral meeting and a joint press conference.

— The White House (@WhiteHouse) July 16, 2018

details.title: Trump, Putin to discuss ways to normalise bilateral relations
details.content:
Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump will discuss ways to normalise bilateral relations, as well as current international issues, primarily the situation in Ukraine, Syria and the Korean Peninsula, and the fight against terrorism. pic.twitter.com/msuboPmAdA

— Russia in USA 🇷🇺 (@RusEmbUSA) July 16, 2018

details.title: Summit continues without talk of Russian election meddling
details.content:
Trump said he and Putin would discuss a range of issues, from trade to the military, along with missiles and China. Not mentioned: Election meddling or Syria.

Trump said last week that he would raise the election-meddling issue with Putin, but said he didn't expect Putin to budge on his denials.
